data.title: Ubuntu 64 bit - "The editor has crashed"
data.body:
OS:
- Ubuntu 14.04 (64 bit)

Atom packages:
- atom-material-syntax
- color-picker
- jsformat
- atom-material-syntax-light
- dracula-theme
- linter
- seti-ui
- atom-material-ui
- file-icons
- minimap
- trailing-spaces

I consistently receive the alert "The editor has crashed".  I started receiving this exception a few weeks ago and had _not_ installed any new packages or modified Atom. I don't know what precipitated this exception.
- I have reinstalled Atom using the Ubuntu Software Center and still receive the exception.
- The Developer Tools console is empty and remains empty after reloading the window.

![screenshot from 2015-09-30 15 52 41](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1623996/10196551/541db3f6-678b-11e5-9152-cf1a0a230a41.png)

data.title: Disallow moving project folder
data.body: Drag-ang-drop 'project folder' to another folder - bad feature, because undo is difficult. Maybe do not allow this or use copy instead move?

data.title: Huge memory leak on Mac OS X and Linux, even on safe mode (10MB per sec) - narrowing the problem
data.body:
Hello, I have a huge memory leak (10MB per sec !), even when starting with atom --safe
- atom versions :  atom-1.0.19-1.fc22.x86_64.rpm   (same issue with 1.0.18 )
- OS: Fedora 22   kernel 4.1.6-201.fc22.x86_64
- OS: Mac OS X Yosemite

To reproduce the issue, you simply have to have this .atom folder containing uniquely:

```
~/.atom $ tree -a
.
├── .apm
│   └── .apmrc
├── config.cson
└── storage
    ├── application.json
    └── editor-79f814a9e20f61c1885b00e04712625e8942ce1e

2 directories, 4 files
```

however, when I delete the file storage/editor-79f814a9e20f61c1885b00e04712625e8942ce1e  ; the memory leak is no more active. It may be somehow related to this file ?
Here is the content of the files:
- .apm/.apmrc : 

```
 ~/.atom $ cat .apm/.apmrc 
; This file is auto-generated and should not be edited since any
; modifications will be lost the next time any apm command is run.
;
; You should instead edit your .apmrc config located in ~/.atom/.apmrc
cache = /infres/s3/sharrock/.atom/.apm
```
- config.cson

```
 ~/.atom $ cat config.cson : 

"*":
  "exception-reporting":
    userId: "edcc3125-7d52-52c1-7768-d57490b1ccc7"
  welcome:
    showOnStartup: false
  core: {}
  editor:
    invisibles: {}
  "one-dark-ui": {}
```
- storage/application.json

```
 ~/.atom $ cat storage/application.json 
[{"initialPaths":["/infres/s3/sharrock"]}]
```
- storage/editor-79f814a9e20f61c1885b00e04712625e8942ce1e: 

```
 ~/.atom $ cat storage/editor-79f814a9e20f61c1885b00e04712625e8942ce1e 
{"mode":"editor","version":1,"windowDimensions":{"x":871,"y":34,"width":1048,"height":1020,"maximized":false},"grammars":{"deserializer":"GrammarRegistry","grammarOverridesByPath":{}},"project":{"paths":["/infres/s3/sharrock"],"buffers":[],"deserializer":"Project"},"workspace":{"paneContainer":{"root":{"id":3,"items":[{"deserializer":"AboutView","uri":"atom://about"}],"activeItemURI":"atom://about","focused":true,"flexScale":1,"deserializer":"Pane"},"activePaneId":3,"deserializer":"PaneContainer","version":1},"fullScreen":false,"packagesWithActiveGrammars":[],"deserializer":"Workspace"},"packageStates":{"find-and-replace":{"findOptions":{"findPattern":"onlyoffice","replacePattern":"","pathsPattern":"","useRegex":false,"wholeWord":false,"caseSensitive":false,"inCurrentSelection":false},"findHistory":["auth","onlyoffice"],"replaceHistory":[],"pathsHistory":[]},"fuzzy-finder":{},"metrics":{"sessionLength":90558},"tabs":[{}],"tree-view":{"directoryExpansionStates":{"/infres/s3/sharrock":{"isExpanded":true,"entries":{".adobe":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".android":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".atom":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".cache":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".ccache":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".cinnamon":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".config":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".dbus":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".eclipse":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".eclipse.old":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".emacs.d":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".fontconfig":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".fvwm":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gconf":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gconfd":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gconfdOLD":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gconfOLD":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gem":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gimp-2.8":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".giteye":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnome":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnome2":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnome2_private":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnome2_privateOLD":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnome2OLD":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnomeOLD":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gnupg":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gstreamer-0.10":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".gvfs":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".icedove":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".icons":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".IntelliJIdea14":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".java":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".kde":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".links2":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".local":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".macromedia":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".mission-control":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".mozilla":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".mplayer":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".npm":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".nv":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".pip":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".pki":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".pulse":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".qws":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".rvm":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".smartgit":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".smartgit.old":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".spice-vdagent":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".ssh":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".subversion":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".swt":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".themes":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".thumbnails":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".uml":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".virtualenvs":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},".x2go":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"bin":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"Desktop":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"Downloads":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"IdeaProjects":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"INF346":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"MesDocuments":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"NTProfile":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"public_html":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"workspace":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"workspace.old":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}},"workspaceNEW":{"isExpanded":false,"entries":{}}}}},"selectedPath":"/infres/s3/sharrock","hasFocus":false,"attached":false,"scrollLeft":0,"scrollTop":0,"width":200}}}
```

unfortunately, when I import the .atom directory with the files above on another account there is no memory leak. Therefore it is hard to reproduce the memory leak only with these files... But I'm sure it's related to the file storage/editor-79f814a9e20f61c1885b00e04712625e8942ce1e

data.title: Suggestion: Select Next (CMD + D) Case Insensitivity Option
data.body:
I think `Select Next` (`CMD + D`) should respect the case sensitivity option of find and replace.
I.E. if find and replace search is set to case **insensitive**, all the following should be treated the same and selectable by `CMD + D`:

```
FooBar
FooBar

fooBar
fooBar
```

This is how Sublime Text does it and for me it's more useful to have as an option.

data.title: Consider an `onDidStopChangingActivePaneItem`
data.body:
Similar to the motivation behind [`TextEditor::onDidStopChanging`](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.1.0-beta.0/TextEditor#instance-onDidStopChanging),  clients of `onDidChangeActivePaneItem` should nearly always wait for a small time period before acting on the new pane item. If the user is quickly switching through tabs or closing several tabs in quick succession, work done on [`Workspace::onDidChangeActivePaneItem`](https://atom.io/docs/api/v1.1.0-beta.0/Workspace#instance-onDidChangeActivePaneItem) is likely wasted and can become a bottleneck for giving feedback to the user if they are switching/closing tabs quickly.

There's at least one candidate in core that could defer its actions until the active item has stopped changing: [`FileInfoView`](https://github.com/atom/status-bar/blob/master/lib/file-info-view.coffee#L71) in the status bar.

Nuclide wrapped `onDidChangeActivePaneItem` to get this effect: https://github.com/facebook/nuclide/blob/master/pkg/nuclide/atom-helpers/lib/atom-event-debounce.js#L29

I think a `DidStopChangingActivePaneItem` should be recommended similar to the one in `TextEditor` if it's created.

data.title: MarkDown not rendering syntax correctly
data.body:
When using backticks to denote code in MarkDown, it seems there is some issue between the editor preview (the text color) and the MarkDown Preview pane.  The Preview displays as expected, but unless you insert line breaks and sometimes an extra backtick in the editor, the editor text stops highlighting properly after certain code blocks.

E.g., if you do inline code, `like this`, then put a header a couple of lines down, the header will not highlight (the syntax is not picked up) in the editor–Atom seems to still think the code block is open.

Please see screenshot for example.

Is this a bug or is there an error in syntax?

![atom-markdown](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1851567/10171146/3020b0e0-669e-11e5-8f17-007ae2f026cc.png)

data.title: backupBeforeSaving does not work for SharePoint/WebDAV shares
data.body:
Hello,

I've noticed that the backupBeforeSaving option in versions 1.04+ does not work for SharePoint/WebDAV shares.  I love the feature itself, but is it possible to do the backup save in a local temp directory, instead of the folder in which we're attempting to save?

Error shown in the popup notification -- there is no stack trace logged in the console:

```
Unable to save file '\path\file.js~'

UNKNOWN: unknown error, open '\\path\file.js~'
```

Thanks

data.title: High Cpu usage by SAMBA process on linux while trying to edit files on SHARED network
data.body:
i love atom and i have using it for months without any problem!.
BUT recently i recognized when ever we try to edit a file, which located on our "LAN NETWORK (a centos6 box with samba-server installed)", the samba cpu usage (on the linux client which installed atom) is raising!
ATOM cpu usage is normal, but "gvfsd-smb" and "gvfsd-fuse" is hogging the CPU!.
if i close the "ATOM" the cpu usage of "gvfsd_" will go down immediately!
and if i start atom "(with safe flag or without)" the cpu usage of "gvfsd_" is hogging again immediately and laptop fan speed is raicing and want to blow up!
What i guess is ATOM is looking for something into the shared directory or something in the background maybe? :/ 
THIS THING happening on WINDOWS too!
On windows, when we open ATOM, the "ExpanDrive SFTP" cpu usage is going for 70% immediately!
and when we close the ATOM, the "ExpanDrive SFTP" cpu usage is go zero.
ExpanDrive is a software we use on windows, to access CENTOS folders and edit them easy.
Our files are located on a Centos6.7 box and we try to edit them via ATOM editor on Windows7 box and LinuxMint box.

I really love ATOM but i can not use if for more then 3 days because of this CPU usage...
any idea?

This thing only happening with 'ATOM". with other editors like "Sublime" we can edit files on shared folder without any cpu hog.

top before lunch atom --safe
![screenshot from 2015-09-29 15 44 46](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7819173/10163640/30e51156-66c1-11e5-817d-2c154a080f45.png)

top after lunch atom --safe
![screenshot from 2015-09-29 15 45 51](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/7819173/10163641/31229e0e-66c1-11e5-9eaf-d17cff231697.png)

data.title: Fix deprecations
data.body:
This is a continuation of #8905.

We deprecated a bunch of methods, but still used them in our core and in bundled packages as well. This PR changes that so that we no longer use the deprecated methods anymore.

Also, Travis will now fail if any deprecated method is hit by our specs.
- [x] Merge https://github.com/atom/find-and-replace/pull/540 and bump version.
- [x] Merge https://github.com/atom/symbols-view/pull/124 and bump version.
- [x] Merge https://github.com/atom/wrap-guide/pull/44 and bump version.
- [x] atom core
  - [x] `::page{Up,Down}`
  - [x] `::selectPage{Up,Down}`

/cc: @maxbrunsfeld @nathansobo

```
error: failed to execute prompt script (exit code 1)
fatal: could not read Username for 'https://github.com': No error
```

After running `apm publish minor` from the repo I'm storing the package into. 

Why is this happening?

data.title: Can't install/update packages - High CPU on Evented I/O for V8 JavaScript
data.body:
